page.title: 03NEAR HAGLEY PARK
page.content: On our Domesday project walk, we went to the Clent Hills near Birmimgham. The only man made features were a few houses,the A456,the obelisk which was a landmark built in the 19th Century and also a ruin of Hagley Castle. Most of the rest was woodland and farmland. The farmland was used for crops and rough grazing, although we didn't see many animals. The crops were mostly wheat and barley. The woodland was coniferous and mixed forest. We walked to the{obelisk.}There is a local story here about{Bella in the Wychelm. } Bella was a young girl who was killed and she was stuffed into a hollow wychelm. There is still a mystery about who killed her. She was killed because people believed she was a witch. All this happened in the early 19th century.
